summary: This bill, the Joan Trumpauer Mulholland Congressional Gold Medal Act, proposes to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Joan Trumpauer Mulholland. The bill recognizes her significant contributions to American life through her lifelong commitment to social justice and equality for all citizens, demonstrated through direct action during the Civil Rights Movement and ongoing educational activities. The bill outlines the presentation, design, and disposition of the medal, and authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury to strike and sell duplicate bronze medals.
